meanings.definition: To renovate and improve a neighborhood, often resulting in the displacement of lower-income residents.
meanings.sent1: The new coffee shop gentrifies the area, making it more expensive for people to live there.
meanings.sent2: The city council's decision to gentrify the downtown area led to many families having to move away.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a luxury spa in this old town really gentrifies the charm out of it.
meanings.sent4: The influx of trendy boutiques gentrifies the once vibrant community, pushing out those who can't afford the new prices.
meanings.sent5: The real estate development gentrifies the neighborhood, turning it into a place only the wealthy can afford.

meanings.definition: To make something more refined or sophisticated.
meanings.sent1: Adding elegant decorations gentrifies the room, giving it a more upscale feel.
meanings.sent2: The designer's touch gentrifies the clothing, making it suitable for high-end events.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to gentrify his wardrobe with a top hat and monocle was met with laughter from his friends.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unique style gentrifies the traditional painting, adding a modern twist.
meanings.sent5: The new lighting gentrifies the stage, creating a more professional atmosphere for the performance.
